message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a high-quality item that will benefit your business. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1200000. This is a competitive price, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I'm confident that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Thank you for your counteroffer, Bob. I understand your perspective, but I'm not willing to go as low as $900000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer the product to you for $1100000. This is still a competitive price, and I'm confident you'll find it hard to find a better deal elsewhere.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to pay $950000 for the product. Can we meet somewhere in the middle?

I understand your target price, Bob, and I'm willing to make another concession. However, I'm not willing to go as high as $950000. I'll offer the product to you for $1050000. This is my final offer, and I'm confident it's a fair price considering the product's value.

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to pay $975000 for the product. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you've made a final offer, Bob, but I'm still not willing to sell the product for $975000. I've already made significant concessions, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm willing to walk away from the deal if we can't come to an agreement. I'm going to have to decline your offer.
